story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message: Over the years, Students' Alumni Cell has grown from an infant into what it is today. Prof Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay, as the Dean of Alumni Affairs an International relations has always been supportive and helped take the cell to new heights. He has now passed on the baton to Prof Baidurya Bhattacharya and the Students' Alumni Cell takes immense pleasure in welcoming him and looks forward to adding more feathers to the cap of Alumni Cell under his guidance.

Ambulance target reached! :D

Thanks once again to the tremendous generosity of our alumni, our ambulance target of $35,000 has been achieved!

Further money raised will go towards the student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services). Our goal is to reach $60,000.

A huge thanks to IITKGP Foundation for taking this initiative for the students.

Once again in tough times, the true spirit of KGP has emerged forth uniting the entire KGP family as a whole. 

#for_a_better_kgp
#every_help_counts

If you get a chance to choose your life again, will you do it differently? What is your purpose in life? “Many Dreams Many Lives”, a book written by our alumna Ms Viji Narayanan (Batch of 1991) follows an Indian women in America who’s emotionally charged self journey begs us to ask these same question over and over again. Cultural discord, marriage, relationship issues with in-laws, world view from different societies, mental health everything is covered in this book. The book will be available on Amazon bookstore in all countries from 11th January 2018 as a paperback print and digital download from Kindle. 
Ms. Viji Narayanan graduated from the Architecture Department, IIT Kharagpur in 1991, is a software engineer and an emerging author with a love for a good story. She is also a  bollywood buff who aspires to make this unique and compelling book into a Bollywood movie one day.
Watch this Book trailer on Youtube to know more about “Many Dreams Many Lives” - https://youtu.be/UXyqPOtCHqE

Days seem so slow and stagnant and we just can’t wait for the BIG days to knock on our doors, but when they finally arrive, they pass as if in a snap of our fingers everything we've been preparing for has already happened. The three days we have been waiting for, pass by as if in a flash, so fast that we can't believe our very eyes. So let us all savour the waiting and the craving. 
With just 25 days to go, we are all geared up to bring you the most enthralling 3 days of January. We are leaving no opportunity, to maximize this experience for you. Let's all take a Journey Back Home and unlock wonderful memories together!

PS- That's KGP from air around 30 years back! :D

Students’ Alumni Cell is grateful to let you know that its initiative along with IIT KGP Foundation has reached about half its target of raising $60,000 to bring in state-of-the-art ambulance for safe and reliable medical care while en route to facilities in Kolkata. We are very thankful to all the alumni for helping their alma mater during these testing times. It is the need of the hour that the student community and alumni community come together to make IIT KGP a wonderful and a safe place to live in. We're close to receiving half of the targeted funds. Every small contribution will go a long way in helping your Alma mater. 
Visit - https://donorbox.org/iitkgp-student-health-and-wellness-program
#for_a_better_kgp 
#every_help_counts

message:
"Time and tide wait for none." We have all heard and feared this quote for our entire lives. But now this quote has a lot of positivity wrapped around it. Only 50 days remain for the Grand Reunion of the Golden, Ruby and Silver jubilee batches. Winter has come and the exams seasons are almost over. Everyone waits with bated breath for the most nostalgic and colorful event of the Campus.
50 days to go for the 15th Annual Alumni Meet. The countdown has advanced further and the smiles are broader than ever. After all friends are going to meet and the amazing stories will be retold...
Picture Credits- Paras Prateek Fotografia

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur with IITKGP Foundation.
message:
In the wake of the recent tragic events that took place in KGP, Students’ Alumni Cell has taken an initiative along with IITKGP Foundation to raise INR 39 L ($60,000) to bring in state-of-the-art ambulance for safe and reliable medical care while en route to facilities in Kolkata. The surplus money raised will be used for student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services).

"Alumni are an integral part of the institute." True to our notions, they have always been a helping hand to KGP and have contributed significantly to its development over the years, be it the Nalanda Classroom complex or halls' development. It is in tough times like these, the true spirit of KGP emerges forth where the entire KGP family unites as a whole. As it is said in RK Hall, “A Great Place to Learn and Live,” let us make KGP a great place to learn and live.

#for_a_better_kgp
#every_help_counts

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos — with Kumar Shubham.
message:
The Student-Alumni Meet, Kolkata was accomplished in full fervour last afternoon. It observed an enthusiastic participation from the alumni and students alike. SAM also saw intense discussions among both students and alumni on the topic Social Entrepreneurship. We would like to especially thank Technology Alumni Association, Kolkata Chapter for their great support and cooperation!

Please stay connected with the page to know more about upcoming Student Alumni Meets and other programs.

Here is a small tribute to the 'Class of 2k17'.

We hope you thoroughly enjoy these as much as you enjoyed the yearbook. Wishing you all the best for your future!
Au revoir!

Once you live in KGP & then KGP lives in you. All those careless times in Cheddi’s and Harry’s, all the tempo shouts and all the memorable times spent in Gymkhana are set to return. Just 75 days remain for the Grand Reunion of oldest and best of friends. Leaving all the worries of daily life behind, the KGPians will be back with the same vigor and tempo that they had so many years ago.
 
75 days to go for the 15th Annual Alumni Meet. The countdown has advanced and the excitement…? Definitely on the peak!

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.
Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added a new photo to the album: Cover Photos.
message:
Students' Alumni Cell feels proud in announcing the final dates for the 15th Annual Alumni Meet, our flagship event organized on campus. The Institute gears up for 12th-14th January, 2018, the days when the alumni will revisit their cornerstone of success. The past will rejoice in the present, old memories will be relived and new memories will be rewritten from them. 

The guests of honour for this year's meet are the Batches of 1968 (Golden Jubilee), 1978 (Ruby Jubilee) and 1993 (Silver Jubilee) and Students' Alumni Cell would like to cordially invite them for the meet.

When nostalgia bit our alumni to the core, when the past met the present, where old memories were relived and old friendships were renewed: The 14th Annual Alumni Meet gave us everything. From mighty musical nights to cheerful hall visits, the last AAM was a 3 day long bliss for the campus and the alumni together.

This throwback video spans the entire 14th Annual Alumni Meet and we'd like to heartily thank the batches of '67, '77 and '92, who attended this meet. 
We also take up the occasion to invite the guests of honour for the 15th AAM, the Golden jubilee batch of 1968, the Ruby jubilee batch of 1978 and the Silver jubilee batch of 1993.

The wheels have been set into motion for the 15th Annual Alumni Meet! :D

"Know Your Alumni"-E3:
Students' Alumni Cell presents its new series 'Know Your Alumni' where it will bring up interviews, blogs and posts about the extraordinary alumni of IIT Kharagpur to you.
In E-3, we have Anuradha Acharya and Subhash Lingareddy, founders of Ocimum Bio Solutions and Mapmygenome.
Anuradha Acharya is the founder and was the CEO of Ocimum Bio Solutions, a genomics outsourcing company for discovery, development and diagnostics, headquartered in Hyderabad, India from 2000 to 2013. She was awarded Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum in 2011.
Subhash Lingareddy is presently the President and CFO of Ocimum Biosolutions and also Founder at Mapmygenome.in. he received Beta Gamma Sigma Honor Society Award in 1996.
They talk about various ventures in their career and about the differences in US and Indian education....

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.
message: The Students' Alumni Cell continuously endeavours to strengthen the relations of the alumni of this Institute and their alma mater. It has been instrumental in organising the Annual Alumni Meet, Regional Student Alumni Meet, regular guest lectures by distinguished alumni in the campus, publishing the annual literary magazine (Yearnings of Yore) & the annual yearbook. The Students' Alumni Cell also operates the Student - Alumni Mentorship Programme, My Imprint (Giving Back - Alumni contribution), recently launched Alumni Career Assistance Program and organises Phonathon, Alvida (the annual farewell dinner) and many more initiatives to bridge the gap between IIT Kharagpur and its esteemed alumni community.

We at Students' Alumni Cell feel proud in launching our latest initiative of  'Alumni career Assistance Program (ACAP)'. This program directly aims at assisting the students sitting for placements by allotting them an alumnus placed 1-2 years back at the company that they're aiming at for placements. The allotted alumnus will act both as a mentor and a buddy and will step by step guide the student through all the confusing placement procedures and also assist in the preparation stage.

We feel that this initiative will greatly help the students at probably one of their most crucial stages in KGP and at the same time will also mark the engagement of the alumni with their alma mater right from the start!

Both alumni and students are requested to follow the link and register with their details: 
http://www.sac.iitkgp.ac.in/acap.php

For further queries, contact:
Utkarsh Sinha (8969169656)

This program directly aims at assisting the students sitting for placements by allotting them an alumnus placed 1-2 years back at the company that they're aiming at for placements. The allotted alumnus will act both as a mentor and a buddy and will step by step guide the student through all the confusing placement procedures and also assist in the preparation stage.

We feel that this initiative will greatly help the students at probably one of their most crucial stages in KGP and at the same time will also mark the engagement of the alumni with their alma mater right from the start!

Both alumni and students are requested to follow the link and register with their details: 
http://www.sac.iitkgp.ac.in/acap.php

For further queries, contact:
Utkarsh Sinha (8969169656)

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 8 new photos to the album: Alumni Talks, September 2017 — with SAIF Partners and OYO.
message:
In the very first version of Alumni Talks (2017–18), we were graced with the presence of our two very talented alumni - Mr. Abhinav Sinha (COO, OYO) and Mr. Arnav Kumar (AVP, Saif Partners). This was a huge success and the audience was immensely inspired by the guests. The message all the students took back home was that for us to be global leaders, we will need to be the type of person a global leader is. 
Read our blog post at- https://medium.com/@studentsalumnicell.iitkgp/serendipity-is-real-but-you-have-to-make-it-happen-alumni-talks-bc438f7e3733

"Know Your Alumni"-E2:
Students' Alumni Cell presents its new series 'Know Your Alumni' where it will bring up interviews, blogs and posts about the extraordinary alumni of IIT Kharagpur to you every week. 

In E-2, we have Dr. Arun Kumar Bhaduri, now the Director of Indira Gandhi Centre for Atomic Research. He discusses in detail about his stay in KGP, his tenure as the Hall President of RK Hall and as the G.Sec Sports as well. Notably he talks about the need for us KGPians to actively look into research and academia as career choices.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.
message:
On this day, amidst the illustrious celebrations of the Institute Foundation Day, we are whole-heartedly wishing IIT Kharagpur many more years of excellence. Remembering the inspiring words of Pandit  Jawaharlal Nehru, the entire alumni and student communities are invigorated with zeal to achieve much more in the coming years.
#HBD_KGP

"Know Your Alumni"-E1:

Students' Alumni Cell presents its new series 'Know Your Alumni' where it will bring up interviews, blogs, posts about the extraordinary alumni of IIT Kharagpur to you every week. To start off, we bring to you the interview of Mr. Aneesh Reddy, Co-Founder & CEO at Capillary Technologies.
Aneesh Reddy is the Co-founder & CEO of Capillary Technologies. With his global vision and focused mentorship, Aneesh leads a team that helps enterprise customers engage with their consumers intelligently, delivering personalized communications to the right consumers at the right time.

Hello IIT-Kharagpur  Alumni,
Unfortunately I am writing a public message since my messages to the alumni cell went completely answered.
I would like to request anyone who knows anyone from the MTech 1982 bacth, specifically from agricultural machinery or related fields, to  please get in touch with me. My father, Late Udai Kumar Singh, who passed away in 1988 was an IIT-KGP alumni and I would love to speak to anyone who knew about him. 
Please feel free to message me. I am really looking forward to any responses or leads. 
Sincerely,
Shreya
